CIRCULAR  NO.   36   / 2002 
 
 
 
 
Reference is invited to this Bureau Circular No. CAS-7 (9) 1992-Div-1 
dated 13.10.1993 and circular No. 44/2000 dated 22.12.2000. 
 
 
Besides the instructions contained in the above mentioned Circulars, the 
following instructions shall be enforced with immediate effect:- 
 
 
SPG is required to provide proximate security to the SPG protectees, as 
mandated under the SPG Act, at all places including the airports.  Accordingly, 
armed SPG officers are deputed fro isolation and ring-around duties at the 
tarmac area of the concerned airport also during the arrival / departure of the 
SPG protectees.  Armed SPG officers are also deployed in advance; fro security 
duties at tarmac area. 
 
 
In view of the above, PSOs of SPG, who are in advance party should be 
permitted in the airport area for security functions in accordance with SPG Act.  
They shall be allowed with weapons and ammunition as mentioned in BCAS 
circulars quoted above.  These instructions may be brought to the notice of all 
security personnel of airport security units for strict compliance. 
 
 
 
(R.K. Singh) 
Addl   Commissioner  of  Security (CA) 
 
Ref. No. CAS-9 (7)/2000-Div-1   dated   14.11.2002
